boat.name: Stadats
boat.full_description:
'Stadats' was built by S.E. Saunders of Cowes for the RNLI in 1921, then named 'Frederick & Emma', as a sailing lifeboat with auxiliary power. She first served at the new lifeboat station in Wick until 1939. She then went to Amble until 1952. During her service for the RNLI she saved 98 lives.

She was purchased by a professional shipwright in 1985 as a bare hull and he fitted her out with new deck and coachroof, engine, rig and interior fitout. For many years, she was used as a liveaboard and family yacht, cruising the East Coast rivers and taking part in traditional regattas and OGA events. Never at the front of the fleet, she was always there no matter what the weather.
boat.short_description: 'Stadats' was built as a Watson class sailing lifeboat 'Frederick & Emma' in 1921. She served at Wick and Amble, rescuing 94 souls, before being sold out of the service.
